[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 12-17] [Environment variable injection] Can an attacker inject malicious values through the NETWORK_NAME environment variable that bypass NetworkName parsing validation, potentially causing the tester to connect to attacker-controlled nodes? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 12-17] [Default value security] Is the default NetworkName::Devnet value safe for production environments, or could forgetting to set NETWORK_NAME cause tests to execute against unintended networks with different security properties? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 12-17] [Race condition] Since NETWORK_NAME uses Lazy initialization, can concurrent access during first initialization from multiple threads cause race conditions or inconsistent network selection across different test threads? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 19-20] [URL injection] Does the hardcoded DEVNET_NODE_URL properly validate the URL scheme and prevent protocol downgrade attacks (e.g., http:// instead of https://) that could expose test traffic to MITM attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 19-20] [DNS spoofing] Can an attacker performing DNS cache poisoning redirect 'fullnode.devnet.aptoslabs.com' to a malicious server, causing the API tester to send test transactions to attacker-controlled infrastructure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 25-26] [URL validation] Does TESTNET_NODE_URL parsing use unwrap() without proper error handling, potentially causing panic if the hardcoded URL is malformed or if the url crate has parsing bugs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 28-29] [Authentication bypass] Is TESTNET_FAUCET_URL protected by authentication mechanisms, or can any attacker directly fund arbitrary accounts during testing, potentially affecting test isolation and resource availability? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 19-29] [URL substitution] Can environment variables override these hardcoded URLs in downstream code usage, and if so, could an attacker inject malicious node/faucet URLs to redirect all test traffic? (Medium)

(Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 36-42] [Negative value injection] Does the parsing logic properly reject negative values or invalid numeric strings for PERSISTENCY_TIMEOUT, or can malformed input cause panic or unexpected timeout behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 36-42] [Default timeout safety] Is the default 30-second PERSISTENCY_TIMEOUT sufficient for all network conditions, or could network delays cause legitimate tests to fail, masking real bugs or creating false negatives? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 45-51] [Sleep duration attack] Can an attacker inject SLEEP_PER_CYCLE = 0 through environment variables, causing the test loop to spin at 100% CPU and DoS the test execution environment? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-api-tester/src/consts.rs] [Lines: 45-51] [Millisecond overflow] When parsing SLEEP_PER_CYCLE and converting to Duration::from_millis, can extremely large values cause overflow or unexpected behavior in the duration calculations? (Low)
